newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan panel's plan may let govt delay BOJ policies.
newsitem.headline: Japan panel's plan may let govt delay BOJ policies.

text.p: An advisory panel considering proposals to reform the Bank of Japan (BOJ) has generally agreed to retain the government's right to delay the central bank's monetary policy decisions, a senior Finance Ministry (MOF) official told a key parliamentary committee on Tuesday.

"The subcommittee of (MOF's) Financial System Research Council has generally agreed on the direction of allowing the government the right to postpone decisions made by the BOJ policy-making board," Kimio Yamaguchi, the director general of the MOF's banking bureau, told a parliamentary committee.

The subcommittee is still in the process of finalising its proposals for BOJ reforms and must still address thorny issues such as the government's right to postpone BOJ monetary policy decisions and to authorise BOJ budgets.
Yamaguchi said that he expected to get a final report from the subcommittee around early February.
